text: Ghana Exports Promotion Authority is a state organization with the mandate to develop, facilitate and promote Ghanaian exports. == Establishment == The institution was established in 1969 by Act 369 as an agency of the Ministry of Trade and Industry. == Structure == GEPA headquarters are in Accra, with regional offices in Ho, Tamale, Bolgatanga, Tamale and Kumasi. The GEPA consist of multiple divisions: * Product Development Division * Marketing and Promotion Division * Research and Information Division * Finance Division * Administration and Human Resource Division == References == __FORCETOC__ Category:Government agencies of Ghana
title: Ghana Export Promotion Authority
